instructions: Blend all soup ingredients together.
Strain.
Re-season and chill thoroughly.
Serve soup garnished with peel, fruit and croutons.

name: Melon and Papaya Salad
ingredients: 1 hot green chilli-halved lengthwise and de-seeded
1 onion, blanched and cut into rings
instructions: Combine the chilli, lemon juice, sugar and water in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil, cool and strain.
Skin, de-seed and cut the papayas and melon into cube.
Combine the fruit with the cooled syrup, season and chill.
Arrange the blanched onions and tomatoes on a plate.
Whisk all the dressing ingredients, season and spoon over the salad. Chill.
Serve the papaya and melon salad with the onion and tomato side dish.

name: Royal Falooda
ingredients: Iced water in a pan with a colander on top of it
Ice cream to top it - optional
instructions: Mix the cornflour with one cup water and bring to a boil, then simmer, stirring all the time.
As soon as becomes translucent, take it off the heat.
In another pan place some iced water.
Transfer the cornflour paste on to the colander (filter or sieve) and press with the spoon so that the pressed paste falls into the iced water in shreds (long lines).
Keep aside for half an hour.
When ready to serve, take four glasses.
Divide the rose syrup into the glasses.
Pour the milk over this equally in the four glasses.
Add 1/4 cup crushed ice and top it with the isabgol seeds and falooda, which have been strained of the water.
Serve.  (You can also serve it topped with a scoop of ice-cream)
Note: A colander is a bowl-shaped kitchen utensil with holes in it used for draining food.

name: Fresh Fruity Cassata
ingredients: Dusting of cocoa and icing sugar
instructions: Slice cake horizontally and line cake tin.
Fill it with vanilla ice cream and then chocolate ice cream reserving three tbsp for top.
Fill center with candied peel, mixed with mango, rum and cream.
Cover with remaining ice cream.
Cover with foil and freeze over night.
Serve dusted with icing sugar and nuts.

name: Apricot Ice Cream
ingredients: 1/2 liter apricot puree - sweetened and strained
instructions: Puree apricots. Dissolve sugar in water and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour into beaten yolks. Whisk until thick. Cool.    Add cream.
Stir well. Freeze, beating at regular intervals until set. (so as to prevent formation of ice crystals)
Serve with praline.
To make praline:
Melt sugar in a heavy pan. Add almonds.
Cook over a gentle flame for about 10 minutes.   Pour onto an oiled tray.
Allow it to set.
Crush with a rolling pin and sprinkle over ice cream before serving.

name: Potato And Yogurt Salad
instructions: Coat potatoes with whipped yogurt.
Heat oil and fry the mustard seeds followed by cumin.
Stir and pour over the potatoes.
Mix in the spring onion and pineapple.
Season.
Crush the bread into rough pieces.
Mix in melon seeds, garlic, green chillies and mint.
Season and pour over the potatoes.
Serve chilled.

name: Fruits with Silken Tofu
instructions: Using a blender, cream tofu and stevia.
Cut pineapple, papaya, apple and pear into dices.
Arrange diced fruits in a fruit bowl and pour creamed tofu on top.
Garnish with mint sprig and serve.

name: Rose Petal Sorbet
instructions: Dissolve sugar in water with rind. Boil for five minutes.
Add rose petals. Leave overnight in a cool place.
Drain through muslin. Add glycerine followed by lemon juice. Freeze.
Stir regularly to prevent crystals forming. Serve with meringue.
To make the meringue:
Whip whites until stiff.
Gradually whisk in sugar.
Pipe onto a greased tray and bake at 160 degrees C for one hour.
Serve with the sorbet.

name: Phalse Ka Sharbat
instructions: Clean berries. Prepare sugar syrup with sugar and water.
Boil for five minutes.
Add the berries and allow to steep overnight. (Steep: Keeping the berries in the sugar-water liquid. This helps improve the flavor)
Blend and strain mixture.
Combine with soda and ice and serve.

name: Minted Chickpeas and Crispy Okra
instructions: Wash and dry the okra.
Cut the okra into thin strips.
For the spice dust:
Mix the okra with some corn flour, flour, red chilli powder, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano powder and some drops of water.
Now fry the coated okra in hot oil until nice and crispy.
Grill spring onions with salt, pepper and lime.
Remove after grilling, put in a bowl with some extra virgin olive oil.
For the salad:
Remove the skin from the boiled chickpeas.
Add some pomegranate, black olives, halved cherry tomatoes, salt and pepper to taste.
Add olive oil, thyme, mint leaves and basil.
While serving, put the crispy okra on top of the salad along with the spring onions in a plate.

name: Trio of Kulfis
instructions: For guava and chooran kulfi:
Mix guava juice, anardana chooran.
Grate ripe guava, without seeds. Put in mould and freeze.
For kaju katli kulfi:
Reduce milk. Add condensed milk. Add sugar if required.
Add green cardamom powder, saffron, kaju katli. Thicken and cool.
Pour in mould and freeze.
For lassi kulfi:
Blend all the ingredients.
Pour the mixture in the moulds and freeze.

name: Kachumbar Salad with Olive Bread
ingredients: 2 tsp whole black pepper, roasted and crushed
One and a half cups milk
instructions: Cut carrots, cucumber, turnip, red onion, and tomato into small 2mm cubes. Mix all these in a bowl.
Add sweet corn, green onion, almond oil, black olives, chopped green chillies, fresh coriander, fresh mint, fresh thyme, amchoor, black pepper and sesame seeds.
While serving, top with hung curd, papad and thyme.
For olive bread:
Knead dough with maida, chopped olives, eggs, milk, sesame seeds, butter, salt and yeast.
Wrap in cling film and keep aside for 1/2 hour.
Cook/bake loaves on tawa or in tandoor, till you get golden brown colour.
Serve with salad.

name: Cherry, Litchi and Rambutan Cheesecake
instructions: Crush the biscuits in a blender then add the butter to make the base.
Pack the base nicely into the cheesecake mould (loose bottomed round tin)
Put in the oven for 5-7 minutes at 180 c.
For the Cherry Puree:
Put the fresh cherries into a blender along with 5-6 lychees and some rambutan.
Add the amarenna cherries and the sugar substitute and give it a good blend.
Whisk the mascarpone with some lime juice and lime zest. After whisking add in the cherry puree. Whisk till it has all amalgamated.
Put the fresh cream into a bowl and whip until light and creamy.
Fold in the whipped cream into the mascarpone and cherry mix.
Put it over the biscuit base and let it cool in the refrigerator.
Once the cheesecake sets garnish with litchis, cherries and rambutan.

name: Vickys Green Soup
ingredients: 4-5 slices of jalapenos with the brine
instructions: Blanch the spinach leaves for 20 seconds in boiling, salted water.
Drain and squeeze out the excess water.
Add the blanched spinach leaves with all other ingredients in a blender to make a nice thick soup.
This can be served either warm or cold.
Serve in a nice glass and garnish with mint leaves.

name: Tuna Pate
instructions: In a mixie, put chopped tuna, sun dried tomatoes, black  olives, egg white, bit of Worcestershire, light cream cheese, a dash of  tabasco sauce, some wasabi, green chilies and grind them well.
It will turn into a paste.
Spread some bread crumbs, roll the tuna pate in it.
And it's ready to eat.

name: Aam Shrikhand with Mango Salad
ingredients: 80 gm pistachio, peeled and not salted
instructions: Mix hung curd with saffron, condensed milk, chopped mangoes, sugar, cardamom powder and cream. Leave to chill.
Prepare mango salad by mixing diced mango with lemon juice, mint and chaat masala.
Serve shrikhand with mango salad. Garnish with gold varq and pistachios.

name: Green Papaya Salad With Mango Dressing
instructions: Peel ribbons of green papaya and slice the cucumber into thin strips.
Put in the spring onions along with the lime zest.
Add one chopped chilli.
Cut the red bell peppers into thin strips and add them to the other vegetables.
Put the mango pulp in a mixer with rice wine vinegar, coriander leaves, mint leaves and olive oil, and give it a good mix.
Season the salad with some salt and lime juice and pour the mango dressing and serve.

name: Phirni Brulee with Strawberry Granita
ingredients: 2 Tbsp sugar (25 gm), or to taste
instructions: For phirni:
Soak rice for 10-15 minutes.
Drain and grind to a coarse paste.
Bring milk to a boil and add the rice paste.
Cook till milk is reduced to half.
Add sugar, almonds, condensed milk, green cardamom powder.
Cook till the mixture becomes thickish.
Set the phirni into desired shape bowls.
For granita:
Chop strawberries. Cook with 25 gm sugar and without water.
Add basil to the mix. Cool down and freeze, overnight if possible.
Scrape off with a fork or knife like ice shavings.
Sprinkle breakfast sugar on top of phirnee and brulee it with a blow torch.
Serve chilled with granita.

name: Walnut Oil Sauteed Green Beans
ingredients: 1 medium sized red bell pepper, roasted
instructions: Peel the skin off of the roasted bell pepper and chop it into thin strips.
Heat the walnut oil and the olive oil in a pan and fry chopped garlic in it.
Then add the chopped bell pepper, pine nuts, cracked black pepper and stir well.
Add the blanched green beans and toss well.
Season with salt and Serve hot

name: Charred Broccoli and Grilled Yellow Squash Salad
ingredients: 1/2 medium yellow squash, cut into thick batons
1 Tbsp of extra virgin olive oil
instructions: Marinate the broccoli and yellow squash with olive oil, cracked black pepper and salt.
Put the marinated vegetables on to the grill.
Baste the vegetables on the grill with olive oil and keep turning them.
Take them off the grill once they get mildly charred.
To make the dressing for the salad, blend together garlic cloves, thyme leaves, extra virgin olive oil, chili flakes, cumin powder and sherry vinegar.
Add the dressing to the charred vegetables and mix well.
Garnish with chives and serve hot.

name: Mixed Lettuce Salad with Grilled Haloumi
instructions: Season the beetroot with salt, pepper and olive oil.
Wrap it in an aluminum foil and bake it at 180 degrees for about 20 minutes.
Once cool, slice it into thin round pieces and keep aside
Slice the Haloumi cheese into thick rectangular slices.
Marinate the cheese with extra virgin olive oil, fresh oregano, zattar spice, sumac spice and roasted cumin powder.
Leave it to rest for 10 minutes.
Grill the marinated Haloumi till it has deep brown grill marks.
For the dressing:
Blend all the ingredients for the dressing together into a thick fluid consistency.
If need, add the vegetable stock.
To assemble the salad:
In a bowl, tear in the rocket leaves, lollo rosso, and ice berg lettuce.
Spoon the dressing into the salad and mix well.
Serve the salad with grilled Haloumi and slice beetroot on the side.

name: Cous Cous Salad with Dry Fruits
ingredients: 1/3 red bell pepper, de-seeded & finely chopped
1/3 yellow bell pepper, de-seeded & finely chopped
1/3 green bell pepper, de-seeded & finely chopped
A pinch of roasted cumin powder
A few leaves of coriander, chopped
1 small bunch of parsley, finely chopped
instructions: Heat the vegetable stock in a pan along with saffron and a pinch of salt.
Bring it to a steady simmer and turn the gas off.
Add the cous cous to the stock so that the level of stock is about 1 cm over the cous cous.
Cover the pot and allow the cous cous to infuse and swell up.
Using a fork, stir the cous cous to loosen and fluff up.
To the cous cous, add the diced bell peppers, dried fruit, powdered spices and freshly chopped herbs.
Squeeze in the lemon juice and toss well together.
Garnish with sprigs of mint and serve.

name: Vaal (Bean Sprouts)
ingredients: Fresh coriander and lime for garnish (optional)
instructions: Dry roast the coconut, red chillies and peppercorns together.
Then grind them to a paste with a some salt and water.
Heat the oil in a pan, add cloves of garlic and fry till they are golden brown.
Stir in the ground coconut paste to it and cook till the oil begins to separate from the masala
Now add the vaal and mix well.
Add water and bring it to a boil.
Then cover and cook on simmer till the vaal is nice and soft but still holding its shape.
Once done, reduce the liquid a little to concentrate the flavors.
Garnish with coriander and a squeeze of lime,
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Udon Noodles Salad
instructions: Cook udon noodles in boiling water for 5 minutes.
Drain out the water.
Rest the noodles in a bowl.
Use a spaghetti peeler to peel cucumber, yellow squash, medium size radish, carrot, a scallion and shitake mushrooms, half a red bell pepper finely chopped; add all the veggies to the bowl.
Mix well.

For the vinaigrette (oriental inspired vinaigrette): a tablespoon of sushi vinegar, 1 teaspoon of light soy sauce, 1 teaspoon of vegetarian oyster sauce, 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil, give it a mix.
Season with salt to taste.
Add the udon noodles to the veggies, and mix with the vinaigrette.
A few sprigs of coriander.
Mix with the veggies.
Serve on a flat plate.

name: Barley and Red Rice Salad
ingredients: ½ cup red kidney beans cooked
instructions: Chop all ingredients and put in a bowl.
In another bowl add orange juice, lime juice, a little salt, pepper and olive oil.
Mix it around.
Add some thyme and pour over the salad.
Garnish with a leaf of basil.

name: Cauliflower Salad
ingredients: 10 gm red bell pepper finely chopped
instructions: For the cauliflower puree:
Slice one cauliflower, put it in a pan with milk, saffron and vanilla.
Boil till the flavours infuse.
For the cauliflower salad:
Grate a few cauliflower florets for it to look like cous cous.
To that add the chopped onion, capers, raisins, red bell peppers, coriander leaves, mint leaves, chopped plum and salt and pepper.
Add a little olive oil.
Add some tang with a cap of white wine vinegar.
Blend the cooked saffron and vanilla cauliflower into a nice puree with a small piece of butter and a dash of milk.
Spread the cauliflower puree on a plate with the salad and garnish with chopped plums and mint leaves.

name: Lemon and Basil Pannacotta
instructions: Put the milk and cream in a sauce pan and bring to a light simmer.
Put some water in the gelatin for it to react and get soft.
Add some vanilla, lemon zest and lemon grass to the milk and cream.
Take a tbsp of the milk and cream and mix with the gelatin.
Add this to the rest of the milk and cream for the pannacotta to become smooth.
Put the lemon juice and the basil, keep stirring.
Strain and put in glasses.
Garnish with bits of basil and refrigerate until set.

name: Watermelon Curry
instructions: Make a paste of onions, ginger, garlic & chillies in a mixer.
Peel the watermelon and blend the chunks to a puree.
In a pot add some light olive oil, Add star anise, black pepper corns, a few cardamom seed and cinnamon stick.
Fry for a few seconds.
Add cumin seeds, coriander powder, kashmiri red chilli powder, onions, ginger, garlic,  chillies paste, garam masala and a small pinch of turmeric, mix well.
Add cooked black beans and strain the watermelon juice.
Add some of the watermelon juice to the cooking spices and beans in the pot, to make a base.
Add the tomato puree.
As the puree is cooking away in the pot, dice the paneer and the mango into medium sized chunks.
Add both to the curry.
Bring it to a boil, season it with salt.
Add basil leaves, lemon juice and fresh coriander leaves.
Garnish with thinly sliced red bell peppers, radish and some chives.

name: Cous Cous Salad with Mango
instructions: In a bowl, add the hot vegetable stock to the cous cous to soften.
Season to taste, add table spoon of olive oil and using a fork fluff up the cous cous.
Chop the fresh coriander and mint.
Mix with the pomegranate, diced mango, season to taste, add the green chilllies, lemon juice and olive oil to the salad.
Serve at room temperature and garnish it with a sprig of mint.

name: Spaghetti with Broad Beans and Pecorino
ingredients: 45 gms pecorino romano (cheese) or parmesan cheese
instructions: Blanch the broad beans in hot water and shock them in cold water to stop them from overcooking.
Cook the spaghetti in boiling salted water.
Sauté the broad beans and spring onion whites, in some butter and olive oil along with some lemon zest, lemon juice and sage.
Add the spaghetti and toss it along with pecorino cheese and cracked black pepper.
Garnish it with pecorino shavings and some sage leaves.
You can substitute pecorino romano cheese with parmesan cheese.

name: Corn and Raw Mango Salad
ingredients: 1 cup corn kernels or corn on the cob
1/2 Tbsp celery stalk peeled and diced
instructions: Blanch the corn in boiling salted water until tender but not overcooked.
Drain, set aside and chill.
Dice the onions, spring onions, red bell peppers, raw mango, pineapple, avocado and celery to almost the same size as the corn.
Cut the cherry tomatoes into half and add the parsley, cilantro and basil to the vegetables.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Add the lemon juice, olive oil and mix well.
Fill into taco shells for presentation or alternatively in a bowl.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry

Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Cucumber, Radish And Ivy Gourd Carpaccio
ingredients: 1/2 roasted and peeled red bell pepper
instructions: Wash and pat dry the cucumbers, tindli/ivy gourd and radish.
Slice lengthwise very finely to create long ribbons.
For the marinade:
Whisk the sugar and salt along with the vinegar, dill, sliced fennel, scallions and lemon juice.
Blend in the olive oil.
Pour the marinade over the vegetable ribbons and rest in the fridge for an hour or so.
Dress the ribbons of veggies on a plate and spoon some red pepper pesto and basil oil.
For the red pepper pesto:
Put all the ingredients into a blender and blitz into a coarse thick paste.

name: Charred Corn, Broccoli and Plum Salad
instructions: In a tray put the corn and broccoli and mix with some salt, olive oil and char grill.
Baste the broccoli and corn with dressing of sumac, zaatar and olive oil.
Remove the grilled corn and broccoli and put in a bowl along with the plums.
Crumble the feta cheese into the salad.
For the dressing:
For the Tagine spice mix:
In a mixer add ginger powder, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, roasted cinnamon, cumin and coriander seeds.
Grind into a powder.
Blend this spice mix along with the orange juice, extra virgin olive oil and brown sugar.
Give it a nice whisk.
Pour dressing on the salad.
Add a few mint leaves to garnish and serve.

name: Carrot Salad with Walnut Vinaigrette
ingredients: 1 big pinch cumin, freshly roasted and crushed
instructions: Blanch the carrots for 30-35 seconds in boiling salted water.
Drain and set aside.
Top and tail the tindli, cut into thin slices.
Add sliced tindli to the sliced carrots.
Mix in the pomegranate seeds with some olives and tarragon.
For the walnut citrus vinaigrette:
In another bowl grate some orange zest.
Whisk in walnut oil, orange juice, lime juice, salt and pepper and some mustard.
Put the salad on a plate and decorate with sliced star fruit.
Pour in the yummy dressing.
Serve.

name: Malabar Cucumber Relish with Peanuts
instructions: In a pan add equal parts of sugar and vinegar.
Add the black peppercorns, fennel seeds and chili paste.
Add fresh lime juice and lime zest to this brine.
Heat & stir until it begins to look syrupy.
Slice the cucumber into thin slices.
Add the sliced cucumber into the pan with the brine.
Transfer into a bowl & cool.
For the chilly crumble:
In a blender add green chillies, coriander leaves, salt, freshly toasted peanuts and blitz until it resembles bread crumbs.
Garnish the pickled cucumber with this peanut crumble and fresh coriander.

name: Vegetable Salad with Red Bell Pepper Jelly
ingredients: 1 whole red bell pepper roasted and peeled
instructions: For the Jelly:
In a mixer blitz together roasted bell peppers, agar agar and tomato juice.
After blitzing, heat up this mixture in a pan to a quick simmer and take it off the fire.
Strain the mix into a bowl to get rid of the skin and seeds.
Put the smooth liquid into moulds of any shape and size and refrigerate until firm and set.
For the Salad:
Put the salad leaves in a bowl and add salt & olive oil.
In a hot pan, heat up some brown sugar, sherry vinegar, salt and red jalapenos.
Put in a blender and blitz. This is the dressing for your salad.
Mix the dressing with the lettuce, diced pumpkin and papaya . Toss well to mix.
Mould this salad in a ring and place the red pepper jelly cubes on top of it.

name: Pomegranate and Mulberry Salad with Mango Caviar
instructions: For the Pomegranate and Mulberry Salad:Put all the ingredients in a bowl and season with parsley, onion powder, sushi vinegar and rock salt.
Give it a nice mix and serve.
Garnish with mulberries and chopped parsley.
For the Mango Caviar:
In a glass bowl blend 0.8 gms of sodium alginate with the mango juice and set aside.
Make a solution of calcium chloride and water.
In another glass bowl, keep some chilled water.
Using an injection drop the mango and sodium alginate mixture in the calcium chloride mixture.
This is a careful steady process.
Once you drop, this will form pearls or very small balls.
Using a slotted spoon or strainer, spoon out the small pearls and drop them into a bowl of chilled water.
This is like a rinse.
Strain and drain the excess water.
Spoon on top of salad.

name: Melon Balls with Rocket and Radish
instructions: In a bowl, add lime juice, honey, olive oil, ginger and salt.
Add chopped chives and give it a little mix.
Rest in the fridge for 10-15 minutes.
Cut the melons into half and remove the seeds.
Scoop out the fruit into small balls.
Use a peeler to peel out ribbons of radish.
Add the radish in a bowl with the melon balls, dressing, chopped fennel bulb, rocket and mint leaves.
Serve cold.

name: Sleek Leek and Raw Mango Fritters
instructions: In a bowl, sieve the chick pea flour.
Cut and add the tomatoes and green mango.
Sweat the leeks in olive oil and butter in a hot pan.
Add this to the batter mix.
Add a pinch of zaatar spice, salt and pepper.
Add the milk little by little to the besan based upon the consistency of your batter while continuously whisking.
The batter should be nice and thick.
Add some oil to a frying pan.
Ladle the batter on the frying pan to form fritters.
To serve stack like a pile or as you wish.

name: Beet, Feta and Orange Salad
instructions: Slice the roasted beetroots.
Add sliced olives.
Crumble the feta cheese.
Season with dill, oregano and cumin.
Wash and dry the lettuce leaves.
For the Dressing:
Mince the ginger and coriander leaves.
Hang the curd in a muslin cloth or a fine strainer to get rid of the excess whey.
Blend the rest of the ingredients to a get a rich creamy dressing.
Toss the leaves with the dressing and place at the bottom of the bowl.
Mix the beetroot and the orange, with the dressing.
Spoon the dressing on top of the leaves, sprinkle the walnuts, feta and chopped herbs over the salad.

name: Chicken Mousse
ingredients: 1 large chicken - cooked, skinned and minced
instructions: Melt butter. Toss in curry leaves and garlic and stir in curry powder. Cook for one minute.
For the Chicken Sauce:Add flour, followed by stock and milk. Thicken over a moderate flame. Then cool.
Gradually add the sauce to minced chicken.
Beat in butter and hung curd. Season well.
Fold in cream. Spoon into a lightly oiled mould.   Chill overnight.
Garnish the chicken mousse with tomatoes and herbs.
Serve the Chicken Mousse with toast.

name: Orange Chicken
ingredients: Herbs like oregano, parsley, thyme, rosemary
1 crusty French bread, you can use regular white bread too
instructions: Saute the chicken in 1 knob of butter for 1 minute.
Pour in juice. Simmer with chicken for about seven minutes until tender.
Stir in herbs and finally whisk in the rest of the butter.
Season well and garnish with orange/sweet lime segments just before serving.
For the garlic bread:
Slice the bread on the diagonal, not quite through to the base at 1 inch intervals.
Combine butter, garlic and pepper.  Spread over each slice.
Wrap in a foil and bake for 10 minutes in a very hot oven.
Unwrap and continue baking to crisp surface before removing from oven. Serve hot.

name: Leafy Salad with Walnuts
ingredients: 3  leafy vegetables  (lettuce, chinese cabbage)50 gm walnuts (grounded)1 Tbsp walnut oil
1 Tbsp sherry vinegar 4-5 cherry tomatoes A pinch of salt
instructions: Mix the leafy vegetables and the cherry tomatoes with the ground walnuts in a glass bowl.
Add the walnut oil and the sherry vinegar to the salad and mix well.
Serve with the parma ham.

name: Watermelon, Olive and Feta Salad
ingredients: 250 gm watermelon planks 1 tsp light soy sauce 1 stalk spring onions 6-7 black olives
Black salt to taste1 tsp parsley (chopped) 3-4 cherry tomatoes 2 tsp pumpkin seeds
1/2 tsp chaat masala 2 tsp olive oil 1/3 tsp oregano leaves A pinch of lemon zest a pinch1 tsp lemon juice 1 tsp sugar
instructions: Peel and cut water melon into rectangular planks or chunks if you like. Season with soy sauce and black salt.
Slice the spring onions thin. Chop the olives. Crumble the feta cheese.
Cut the cherry tomatoes into half.
Toast the pumpkin seeds, sprinkle the chaat masala with sugar.
Prepare a dressing by whisk together the olive oil, oregano, lemon juice and zest, in a mixing bowl, olives, the spring onions, cherry tomatoes, feta, with the dressing. Season to taste.
Place the plank of watermelon on the plate and mount the salad high on the plank. Sprinkle the pumpkin seeds and drizzle the rest of the dressing.

name: Chicken Piccata With Bread Salad
ingredients: For the Chicken:2 chicken breast (batted thinly) 1/3 cup flour 1 egg 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese 1 tsp parsley1 tsp chives 1 Tbsp butter 1 tsp olive oilSalt & pepper to taste
1 small loaf ciabata bread 2 tomatoes 8 olives1/2 each bell peppers yellow 3 basil leaves1/2 cup olive oil 2 tsp red wine vinegar 1/2 cup tomato juice 1/3 cup sun dried tomatoes
instructions: For the Chicken: Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Make a batter with the Parmesan cheese, parsley, egg, chives.
Beat well. Dip the seasoned chicken into the flour and then into the batter.
Shallow fry in a mix of olive oil and butter until golden brown.
For the Salad:
Cut the bread into chunks. Sprinkle some olive oil, and bake for 6 minutes.
Set aside to cool slightly.
In a bowl mix the tomatoes, olives, yellow bell peppers and the sun dried tomatoes. Season to taste with salt and cracked black pepper.
Whisk together the tomato juice, red wine vinegar, olive oil, and the basil. Pour over the bread. Add it to the tomato and olive mixture.

name: Greek Salad
ingredients: 1/2 bunch romaine lettuce 1 cucumbers (peeled & de-seeded) 1 red onions 1/4 each bell peppers 6 olives 5 cherry tomatoes 30 gm feta cheeseA pinch of oregano 20 ml red wine vinegar40 ml olive oil Salt & pepper to taste
instructions: Wash and prep the vegetables into chunks. Whisk together oregano, red wine vinegar, salt, pepper and olive oil.  Pour over the dressing.
Toss and serve the salad chilled.

name: Poached Prawns in Tropical Fruit Salsa
ingredients: 1 kiwi fruit 1 small papayaMusk melon Salt & pepper to tasteBasil leaves to garnish2 Tbsp sweet chilly sauce 1 coriander leavesJuice of 1 lemon500 ml water
instructions: In a pot take 500ml water and bring it to a boil. Add  coriander leaves and the juice of 1 lemon and poach the prawns in it.  In a glass bowl diced the kiwi fruit, papaya, melons and some spring onions.  Scoop out the flesh of a coconut into a processor and add some sweet chilly sauce and blend well to make a fine puree.  Mix the puree into the bowl of fruits and dice in some of the poached prawns to the salsa.  Serve in martini glasses and garnish with basil leaves.

name: Yogurt Dip with Crudites
ingredients: For the dip:250 gm hung yogurt1 stalk spring onions, finely chopped1 medium cucumbers, peeled1 tsp dill, chopped1 tsp parsley, chopped1/4 tsp roasted cumin powder 10 ml olive oil 5 ml lemon juice Salt to tastePepper to taste
For the crudites:  1 carrot 1 radish 1 cucumbers 1/2 each red bell peppers1/2 each yellow bell peppers 1/2 each green bell peppers 6 asparagus srears 4 baby corn
instructions: For the dip:  Put the chopped herbs in a large bowl, add the hung curd, lemon juice, olive oil and season to taste. Mix well and chill.  Prep up all the veg. Serve along with the dip.
For the crudites:  Peel and prep the vegetables. Soak in a bowl of chilled water to refresh.

name: Grilled Squid
ingredients: 4 large carrots (peeled and cut into angle into oval) 2 red onions (peeled and cut into rings)16 green olives12 coriander seeds (coarsely crushed) 1 small lemon (cut into 5 mm - 1/4 inch dice, seeds removed) 25 ml sesame oil 35 ml sunflower oil 2 Tbsp fish sauce 25 gm coriander seeds For the squid:   4 squids (cleaned) 2-3 Tbsp sesame oil (optional)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200 Degrees. Mix all the salad ingredients except the coriander leaves together and place in a     roasting dish. Cover with foil and roast for 20 mins.  Remove the foil, stir well, cover the dish again and roast for a further 15 mins.  Remove the foil and continue cooking until the carrots start to caramelise.  Remove from the oven and leave to cool, and then stir in the coriander leaves. For the Squids:   To cook the squid, either grill or fry in a wok with the sesame oil, for 1-2 mins.
To   assemble, spoon the salad and any juices on to a  plate and top with the grilled squid.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
